meanings.definition: To surpass in bet or wager.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to surbet her friends in friendly games.
meanings.sent2: He decided to surbet his opponent by raising the stakes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel surbet the rabbit in the race to find the acorns.
meanings.sent4: The student surbet the teacher's expectations with his outstanding project.
meanings.sent5: The superhero surbet the villain's evil plan with his quick thinking.

meanings.definition: To bet more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: I will surbet you by putting all my savings on this horse.
meanings.sent2: She likes to surbet her friends during poker night.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to surbet the dog by placing a bigger bet.
meanings.sent4: The gambler surbet everyone at the table with his bold moves.
meanings.sent5: He always surbets his opponents to show his confidence in the game.

meanings.sent1: The millionaire liked to surbet his wealth on risky ventures.
meanings.sent2: She tends to surbet more than necessary in card games.
meanings.sent3: The penguin surbet the other animals by betting all his fish.
meanings.sent4: The risk-taker surbet his entire savings on the final round.
meanings.sent5: He would always surbet his luck, hoping for a big win.
